condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: The WASH sector at national and subnational levels have increased capacities and expand equitable and sustainable access to safe and affordable drinking water and sanitation and hygiene services.

description.narrative: UNICEF enabled 2.8 million people gain access to safely managed water supply services, 1.3 million people have access to safely managed sanitation services, and 530,086 pupils and 225,615 health workers, patients and their families have access to WASH services in schools and health facilities, respectively. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support

Number of health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Proportion of people with access to a safe drinking water source in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Proportion of rural population in UNICEF focus LGAs with using safely managed drinking water services
